1866.
Monday, July 9. Pleasant day  Rode with Holden to the Creek in the morning calling at Michaels on the way  Work some—not much. By invitation call at night to See Miss ___ & find her brother a young lad. Spend the evening pleasantly

1866.
Tuesday, July 10. Hot today  Have done more work than usual today. Am troubled with indigestion & feeling uneasy & unpleasant  At night called with Mr Holden at Mr Owens & spent a pleasant evening with Mrs Chilcote & later with Mrs Owen & Banta?  Returned & took some ice cream & while eating there was an alarm of fire at the old factory. No damage done

1866.
Wednesday, July 11. Very warm today  Have worked some in the office & have made some money I trust Slept a little after dinner.  At night called upon Miss ⸺ & took a long walk

1866.
Thursday, July 12. A very warm day  Worked some in the office & played some with Holden. In the evening he & I took a walk going down to the pran? yard & around town. He communicated to me the secret of his ⸺⸻  Ratck? Anderson & Miss Wilson married tonight. Sherman has gone. His Bro Jim came & slept in her bed

1866.
Friday, July 13. Hot enough  Busy in the office though nothing new  At night went to the ME Sociable & had a pleasant time at the house of Billy Wilson  Went home with ______ & had a walk beyond. Counseled as to the matter of Frank Siber vs Pratt? on misuspecting female

1866.
Saturday, July 14. Another hot day  These days are very hot. As busy as I cared to be. JS Butler from Muscatine unclear & a Mr Hawkins of Chicago are here on business connected with a claim of Wm R Slire vs? ?  Sued out a writ of Replevin  At night called upon ____ and I said what I never said before ⸺  _______________________  All satisfactory

1866.
Sunday, July 15. A hot Sunday  Did not rest well last night after the excitement of the evening before & yet rose early this morning  Examined the Records as to the title to the unclear. Went to the Pres Church. Slept after dinner & went to ME Church at night  Took a ________ with Mr Emager? & now at 12 mi am about to retire

1866.
Monday, July 16. Warm but not so warm as for a few days past  Have been busy in & about the office.  The bank began suits against D J Nostein? & ? Wm R Stone by attachment. There is a good time coming in this matter  Was commended in a  Driver? suit which a Mrs Collins wishes brought but she has no money  Met Miss ―― tonight on the street. Wonder what she thought ―

1866.
Tuesday, July 17. Hot day. In the evening had a heavy shower with some wind  Spent the day in the office as usual though did not do much  At night called upon Miss ―― found her out but she soon returned & I foolishly staid pretty late

1866.
Wednesday, July 18. Not quite so hot today though still warm enough. ? law books came today & I worked & placed them away  At night went with Holden to Dr Perkins and afterward to Hales when we met Mr & Mrs Conden?

1866.
Thursday, July 19. Cool pleasant beautiful day. Was in the office all day  Read some & played some. At night went to the Pres' Sociable at Mr Freltars? Went unclear with Miss W ―― & did not stay long  Took a walk upon return & retire at 11-15 PM  Nothing exciting in town

1866.
Friday, July 20. A very pleasant day  Was at home all day  Read some law & played C-Jack with Holden some.  Sherman went to Richmond to to attend to getting a contract with Mrs Haigler? as to fees in such about why in against Sawey? to redeem some land

1866.
Saturday, July 21. Hot day as usual  Spent the day in the office as before. Read some  Had but little business as business is now very dull  At night called upon ―― and took a walk & finally visited upon the steps of the _ _ _ _ _ _ _Church where  ______ ___ _ _ _ _ _ _ __   Did not retire until late

1866.
Sunday, July 22. Very hot today  Rose late in the morning Did not go to church until night & then went to ME Church & heard a minister present the claims of the Union Miss Missionary Society Have read some in the Atlantic Monthly. Have been sitting in Holdens Room talking of a variety of subjects  Tonight is cool & pleasant with a fine breeze. I write this sentence by? the ?oth? in the West Room. She was asleep—the moon peeping in at the window

1866.
Monday, July 23. Very warm day  Nothing unusual today Darius went to Dayton leaving his wife behind (Such a wife!)  Spent the day in the office doing but little  At night called at Dr Mckees  spent the evening pleasantly with the family  Went to Holdens soon upon my return & did not retire until near midnight

1866.
Tuesday, July 24. Rained very hard this morning. Some heavy thunder  Holden left for Chicago & I loaned him $20. He has some fears as to his connection with Wm R Stone.  At night I called in company with Miss _____ upon Mrs Thompson & spent the evening very pleasantly. Returning sat with ____ for some time & retire cold?

1866.
Wednesday, July 25. Rained again last night & has been very hot all day. Nothing doing. Very dull in town  At night played Eucher in the office with Rheinart Denny - Richards & Dewey. Spent a pleasant evening but quit early  Nothing unusual today

1866.
Thursday, July 26. Hot—very hot all day  Capt Campbell came on the cars to day and near night  I go with him out to Rev Hammands to see Miss Aggie. We take Holdens horse & buggy. I unhitched the horse from the buggy then & tied him to the fence from which he broke loose & ran down over the prairie undoing & losing a portion of the harness. Mr McAvoy caught him  We stay at Mr Hammands & in the evening sit in front of the house in the mon? moon? light & talk of a variety of subjects

Friday, July 27 1866
Rested very poorly last night. Was bitten some by mosquitois  & tonight by bed bugs. Rose at 4 in the morning feeling tired & badly. Went in search of the missing portions of the harness but failed to find it. After breakfast with some trouble harness up the horse & start for town when we arrive in safely, & find the folks had been considerably scared about us. At night visit Miss & find she too had been frightened. Return home pretty late & sleep or attempt to in my old cot

1866.
Saturday, July 28. Was again nearly eaten up by bed bugs last night which seem to have made the old cot their home  I trust such nights as the last will be few in my experience. Today I have had my vengeance & know? they are less curious? of the human race in our midst than before. Captain Campbell left today. I went walking & met my friend  ____ We sat upon the steps to the church for some time—the old 2nd U P Second United Presbyterian

1866.
Sunday, July 29. Rose late this morning . Went to the Pres' Presbyterian Church in the forenoon & to the M E Methodist Episcopal Church at night. Slept in the afternoon for a long time. After church called at Mrs Axtells a while. Holden has just been in & read to me an article he is preparing against Brown  Weather is still very hot. Have read some in the Atlantic Monthly & retire at about 12 M

1866.
Monday, July 30. Not so hot as for some days past though still quite hot  Attended to a case before Esq Long. Moore & Reyes vs Morris & Wife. Attended to the business of the office during the day. At night commenced a game of eucher & left my place to Dewey & took a walk with Holden.  Miss ―― out riding on horse-back. Holden is preparing an article for Press against Brown

1866.
Tuesday, July 31. Nothing unusual today. Have learned of the successful laying of the Atlantic Telegraph Cable  At night called upon _____ at the house  Nothing new  Made arrangements for a visit tomorrow night

1866.
Wednesday, August 1. Nothing unusual today  Weather warm  At night called at Mr Lewis room & then met Miss _____  & spent the evening. Mrs Chilcote & Mrs Owen came while we were there but did not stay but a moment  After the visit took a walk & enjoyed the moonlight night from the church steps the 2 U P Church Second United Presbyterian

1866.
Thursday, August 2. Pleasant day - Not so hot as before  Quiet in town — little or nothing doing any where  At night called with Holden upon Mrs Owen Banta?&c. Did not stay late

1866.
Friday, August 3. Wrote a letter to Lib today about home matters & offered my lot at $300.00?  Received a little note from ―― Wishing to see me. Went at night & spent a pleasant evening — returning at about 11.30 P M  Nothing new. Has been very hot again today  Recd a letter from Mt Pleasant wishing myself & Miss? to go to a picnic near Rughton?  & unclear went Mt Pleasant & Fairfield

1866.
Saturday, August 4. Cool pleasant day  Attendee ? Rep..? Convention & nominated James Clerk & Jeffrey Rienan  Have read some law & done a little business   Not many persons in town & not much interest manifested in the Convention  Holden sits up with the corpse of Andrew Conden? who died last night

1866.
Sunday, August 5. Cool pleasant morning. Am sitting on the ground in the woods West of town writing this with a little dog by my side. It is a most lonely spot. Nothing to be heard but the singing of the birds & the sighing of the winds through the trees above my head. The church bells of town have just rung ――― Attended the funeral of Chr?..rn? Gordon?. At night took a walk with Miss  ――― & made arrangements for the picnic. I am not going. Got some time in the walk over [unclear]] John Boerrs?

1866.
Monday, August 6. Nothing unusual today  Preparations being made for the Picnic tomorrow  Holden is going with Miss W――   Funny!

1866.
Tuesday, August 7. Rained last night & rains this morning & the company which were going to the Picnic are surely disappointed. At night called upon Miss It rained & I was caught & compelled to stay late. Alas!

1866.
Wednesday, August 8. Pleasant day  Sherman went to Harrisburg. Getting back after dark. I was alone in the office. But little doing. Made one deed for Rev Erlls/  Played Eucher at night with Rheinart Richerds Thompson Dewey &c.  Wrote a letter to Eunice submitting plan for house & a bill for the same made by Mr Conner
on side: This is the unclear for 9 12?

1866.
Friday, August 10. Warm today  Wrote a letter to Mrs ? Ashton & sent her my photograph in accordance with a promise made last while there last [summer lined out] month  At night called upon Miss ―― & spent the evening   Rained a little today

1866.
Saturday, August 11. Very warm again today  In the office all day  Not much doing in town though there were a good many people in town.The goods in War? homes were sold today. At night there was a heavy thunderstorm and some wind  The lightning was very vivid

1866.
Sunday, August 12. Warm day  Rose at about the usual hour. Took a fine bath — then attended the Pres' Church. The Organ was played for the first time in the church during service  After dinner took a nap or  attempted to do so but the flies were so troublesome that very little enjoyment was had.  At night accompanied Miss ―― to the Pres' Church to hear Rev John Helke preach. Did very well. After church sat some time with Miss at her home

1866.
Monday, August 13. Warm again though not so hot as yesterday. Been at home all day working at the examination of the Records in the Treas? Office &c  Sat with Mr Jenkins & had quite a lengthy conversation on political & other matters this evening. Have just returned from quite a lengthy walk for exercise about town. Sherman & Will are both out tonight

1966.
Tuesday, August 14. The nights are cool now but the days warm & pleasant. Everything is very quiet in town & country. Received a little note just at night & as requested went walking. Went down by the graveyard. Retd about ――

1866.
Wednesday, August 15. Cool pleasant day  M E Sunday school have a picnic at the college grove today  There is a Field Band in attendance. Sherman has gone to Yulter? on the McClun estate business & I am alone in the office. Nothing hardly doing  Campbell sold his town lot today  At night played eucher in the office with Richerds Dewey & Thompson

1866.
Thursday, August 16. Cool pleasant day  But little doing this days  At night called down to see ―――― & afterward went to the sociable at Rev Shearers. Met there Mrs McJenkin & spent a pleasant evening

1866.
Friday, August 17. 
Today quarelled & settled with J V? Bishop & [[McGoughy?] - Sued? Mc & then settled. He was very mad. Took his note after throwing off a part of the account  At night played eucher in the office with Rheinart Richards Denny Dewey Sherman &c. Spent the evening pleasantly

1866.
Saturday, August 18. Rains this morning  Nothing very unusual  Made a call at night & spent the evening of course

1866.
Sunday, August 19. A very pleasant day Went to the M E Church in the morning & heard a new preacher—whose voice was as sweet as the filing of a saw. Took my usual bath  After dinner took a sleep. After supper walked over to my land East of town.  At night went to the Pres' Church to a meeting of the ? Bible Society. Afterward took a walk with ____ until pretty late

1866.
Monday, August 20. Spent the day at home  cool & pleasant. Rec'd a letter from home which I answered—scolding some. Pretty busy in the office  Recd a note at night & called to see the mother underlined & afterward called at Mr Conners & spent the balance of the evening. The Methodists voted to have an Organ tonight & the Pres' today to rent their hens

1866.
Tuesday, August 21. Beautiful day  Holden came back today. I had an executive issued for Trent & Roels vs Marsh?

1866.
Wednesday, August 22. Nothing unusual occurred today to cause it to be [unclear]]. At night went to ___ & met Miss _____ & spent the evening. (Sunshine & showers unclear unclear  ?)

1866.
Thursday, August 23. This day was as the past. No unusual incident - unclear it is now very dull and monotonous.  At night played eucher in the office with Rheinart & Thompson this sentence was crossed out   Had a warrant issued against Rippey upon the information of Leonard Elias  Busy in the office all day

1866.
Friday, August 24. Cool but not unpleasant - Went with William up to Dayton to see Darius on business. Had a pleasant ride & got back just at night  Found Darius pleasantly situated & doing as well  At night upon our return played eucher in the office for him in three hours   Settled today with Squire Asben taking his note

1866.
Saturday, August 25. Worked pretty busily today. Compromised the criminal case against Rippey got a pretty good fee which was the matter of most importance  At night called again to see ____  Found other company. Took a walk. Too cold to stay out long & I ret'd early & retired

1866.
Sunday, August 26. Went to Pres. Church morning & night  Camp meeting at Richmond & every one gone there nearly. Slept some after dinner—then went to my favorite unclear in the woods - Found the mosquities very bad & did not stay long  At night after church saw my dulcinea & stayed until bed time

1866.
Monday, August 27. Pleasant day. In the office all day. Business pretty good. Shared two notes pretty handy which we bought of a patent Right man. At night played Eucher in the office with Thompson Denny Richards & Sherman  Have talked some with Lewis as to the sale of my store building. Was offered $5000.

1866.
Wednesday, August 29. Pleasant day   Worked examining the unclear today in regard to Mr Foster? land - Sold the building today  to Lewis for $5500  Mr Marbry came back today & I fear he & Jenkins feel a little sore  Hurt I sold & turn others out. They have Centles? buillding   At night called on ______ & sto?d? pretty late

1866.
Thursday, August 30. Pleasant until just at night when it rained a little.  Have done but little today save Settling my sale to Lewis of the Building taking $2000 down & the ballance next June & a year from then  Sometimes feel almost sorry I sold — but do not wish the property back now  Played with Holden a little this evening Will Fisher Skinner Shel?ed? & the boys left this morning for home  Settled the unclear down for $1000 which which unclear has him new? unclear

1866.
Saturday, September 1. Worked to day in examining into  & beginning the case of the State against John Kennedy for assault & Battery. Jury called & when Sustained?— too late unclear into trial & the case? was continued until next Monday  At night played Eucher in the office, & Spent the same pleasantly  Nothing new

1866.
Sunday, September 2. Pleasant day  Went to ME Church morning & night & after church met ____ & staid until pretty late  Read some in the Atlantic Monthly & slept some.  Mrs Chilcote wished to see me & I called on her. Poor woman she is too sensitive  Looked up the law a little for the case tomorrow

1866.
Monday, September 3. Trial began at 11 am & we worked hard at it until 12 at night when the jury brought in a verdict of guilty, & he was fined $25 & took an appeal. Pretty well  pleased with the result but McPerkin is disappointed & a little sour   Heavy thunder shower tonight

1866.
Tuesday, September 4. Nothing unusual today  Spent the day in town & in the office the most of the time  At night called where I do so often & we talked over matters that may be talked over more in future  Am dull & stupid tonight as I did not sleep but little last night  Settled with Ed Stone today & of course quarrelled but finally got my pay

1866.
Wednesday, September 5. Jenkins bought the old Post Office building & I received $1800 from? him from my own money & that of fathers in my hands. Shared him on notes received about $80  Nothing very unusual today. Weather warm & pleasant. Been quite busy in the office & are now? making some money. At night played Eucher in the office with Thompson Richards Sherman &c. Wrote a letter to Wills in answer to his

1866.
Thursday, September 6. This is the Show day for Yankee Robinson & the whole county is here. Not much business done I think in town though we did considerable in the lunsr?  At the night went with the folks at the house to the show. I went with Mrs Axtell

1866.
Friday, September 7. Not much doing in town today. At night I went to see ___ & spent the evening. In the morning Mrs Chilcote rushed to see me & went to her room & she was feeling  lonly? about what Mr Holden was saying & doing to injure the bank. She cried & I felt real sorry for her—she being unclear & unhappy because her husband the Dr was gone

1866.
Saturday, September 8. Sherman went to Richmond as a kind of arbitrator in the Manf? Brown matter & I have been in the office all day doing but little Been quite dull  Dr Chilcote came back today

1866.
Sunday, September 9. Rainy & muddy all day. Slept until 8 o clock. Did not go to church at all. Took a mini? bath in the morning  Read a little in the law May a ruin?.  After dinner took another sleep  At night went to meet ___ & spent the evening

1866.
Monday, September 10. Rained last night & rains today. Cleared off in the evening. Show in town but a bad day for it & ? excitement? - Been busy in the office writing letters & c. Have not made much money for today & yet have worked hard. Genl Cleifman ? left a lot of old worthless notes & gives us the half for collecting. Holden & I played cards awhile in the office

1866.
Tuesday, September 11. Busy in the office all day. Transacted considerable business. Not a very pleasant day  At night called ___ upon Mrs Chilcote at Mr Owens & afterward upon Miss ____ and spent the evening

1866.
Wednesday, September 12. Cool but rather pleasant  Been at home all day & tolerably busy  Finished the sale? of the 40 ? of our tax Card to James Stewart & took his notes for all but $10. which he paid to us  At night played Eucher in the office with Thompson, Conn? &  Sherman. Had a class? & interesting game

Thursday, September 13 1866
Nothing unusual today  At night called upon Miss ___ & spent the evening (not the night -  - Busy day in the office & we made some money

Friday, September 14 1866
A little frost this morning in some p?ns? ? - Cool but pleasant day - Been at home & busy in the office drawing up papers & attending to other business  Nothing new today

Saturday, September 15 1866
Cool out & unpleasant nearly the whole time now - N? Brokway? was in today & concluded to bring a suit against the N S Ex? company & I drew up the papers & examined the case  So not & unpleasant not much done in town  Received a letter from Wm in which he writes that Father has concluded at last to come in? here & live in his (Wm) house  Played Eucher a few minutes at night - Holden came back from Muscatine & went on to Chicago

Sunday, September 16 1866
Wet cold & unpleasant again today  Did not go to church - Washed & worked some  At night called upon ___ & staid until it was late  Nothing new

Monday, September 17 1866
Worked in the office pretty well without doing much - Sherman was taking deposition in the afternoon & until a late hour at night & I again drew up anew the petition gst? the Express Company

Tuesday, September 18 1866
Rains all the time now   Same routine in the office as on other days  Have been examining the law - the case against the Express Company  At night called to see my gal

Wednesday, September 19 1866
Rained all day & all last night & still rains without let.. hindrance  Worked in the office all day - Sherman taking depositions again today - Played a few games of cards at night -  Ret'rd at about 11 PM

Thursday, September 20 1866
Rained more today - Mud as deep as the sea - Worked in the office though did not do much - Dull enough - No one in town - Made arrangements for a loan? of $300 to Alx Hnek?

Friday, September 21 1866
Did not rain today for a wonder - Cool & not very pleasant honerer? - Spent the day at home in the office  At night went to the ? Festival but did not stay there long but returning played Eucher in the office with Rheinart & c  Retire at a reasonable hour  Ordered a suit of clothes if sd fits unclear of Chicago

Saturday, September 22 1866
Sunshine some today but at night again threatened rain  did sprinkle a little  At home all day - The suit against the Express Company was settled by the PWF? ? fi?ishg? & think fee about $23 of which we got $9.00  Played cards again a short time at night  Sherman has a ? cold & is almost sick

Sunday, September 23 1866
Went walking in the morning to the woods with Holden - Came back & went to Pres Church - at night called upon ______ & spent the evening   Beautiful day

Monday, September 24 1866
Pleasant day  Judge Sp?ngt?]] came to hold  Court in the place of Judge Longhnge? - The docket called through but little done   Am not & have not a few days of court as the proper? inform? us  Sold the note to Richerd for? $500.

1866.
Tuesday, September 25.
Beautiful day  Worked in court & afternoon took in? our defaults & judgments  Then on to the [[unclear}} jury trials as it is understood  At night played Eucher in the office a little

Wednesday, September 26 1866
Beautiful fall day  Court adjourned after dinner  Wilson Wans? spoke in the afternoon in the Court House yard - Pleand? went? to both of the men?   Fair began? today - I did not attend

Thursday, September 27 1866
Big crowd in town today to attend the fair and the fair was a success as I understand - Continued another day  Busy in making arrangements for getting? the safe with ?et? did not accomplish it -  Do it tomorrow night I hope   Went to see ____ & staid until late  Have a bad cold & am almost sick

Friday, September 28 1866
Beautiful day  Staid at home in the forenoon but after dinner went to the fair & remained the whole  part of the afternoon - The fair did not amount to much - Not many there while I was there - One man thrown from his horse & was hurt  Tonight worked getting the safe out of the office to the street

Saturday, September 29 1866
Worked hard all night without sleeping a wink  - Went without my breakfast - Did not get the safe put into the street until the forenoon was pretty nearly gone - Am so tired tonight - Millie? left for home today - Was up to the office to see me before leaving  Her brother came for her   Beautiful day  Sherman has been all day trying the case of state? Cetteller? against Brown? & Sewell -  Nz? & McPinkin?}} defeated Lewis & Bennet

Sunday, September 30 1866
A very pleasant day - Rose about the usual time - After breakfast cleaned up the office (Quite a Job!) & then took a bath before dinner  At night went to the Cong' Church & heard Rev Cross? preach from the text 'Pr..? all things - Hold fast that which is good  Vuit? Andr?es?]] united with the Sweede church No 2? today
Note: Prove all things; hold fast that which is good -- from Thessalonians 5:21

Monday, October 1 1866
Sherman & McJenkins went to Sigourney today - I have been all day moving to the room over Deneys store & in cleaning up the office  Hard work Joe Slwv?t? helped me some  The new room looks quite comfortable now  Beautiful day  Paid Boirs? $1.70? for one of his Cen..? & the breaking of one in ? pieces   Massey was all the forenoon hauling the lumber

Tuesday, October 2 1866
Cooler today but still very pleasant  Wrote letters to Will Darius & Lb  Mettin?  Have been around all day  Sherman is fine? Commended? not for Deney Lot? Asher? Young? g? Attachment  Lewis paid me ? 700 dollars ? & I settled for the rest of last month   Read & burned? many of my old letters - at night Sat up until midnight  Paid Mrs Axtell $20.00 as board bill  Holden went to see Helen? tonight

Wednesday, October 3 1866
Pleasant day - Sherman ? at Sigourney - returning just at night - But little doing -  Began a suit for Deny against Asher Fny?  Rode out with Holden to the Mt Pleasant Ford? in the afternoon  At night attended the reunion of the ?ffi?s of the F?Ry? at borellrs? Hall - Passed the evening pleasantly & responded to a toast

Thursday, October 4 1866
Another pleasant day - Worked in the office all day  Not much doing in town

Friday, October 5 1866
Pleasant day  Mrs Chilcote returned from Muscatine not going any further than there  Wrote a letter to M ____  Been busy in the office looking in the old dockets of Esq Henders? & c  11 P M Have just returned from a long walk with Holden around the town

Saturday, October 6 1866
Sherman went to Brighton to attend to the arbitration where between Hoffafing? v? Diller & did not return at night - I was at home - Settled the case of Deney agst Asher Yny? & got the money  Beautiful day - as - fact all of them are now

Sunday, October 7 1866
This morning Holden & I went & Rheinart and were gone all day - Getting back not until about 11 at night  Stopped in our way back at the Wells School hnn? & heard preaching - They are having a good deal of rhyms? excitement ?nt? in Dutch b??p? & my? unclear -   Some men baptised today  Ther men are in ? very laughable incidents occurred today - one while our horse was drinking from D - A   This Ane? blossm was taken from Rheinarts yard

Monday, October 8 1866
Rained a little last night but not enough to make much? mud?  - At home all day and doing business  Rec'd a letter from her  I _________ best & write to her  text covered by dried flower  letters - ? after I recd  covered text Recd a covered text

Rained a little last night but not enough to make? much? mud?  - At home all day and doing business  Rec'd a letter from her  I _________ best & write to her two letters - one before & one after I rec'd her letter  - Recd a letter from Will

Tuesday, October 9 1866
Cool but pleasant day - Feel unsettled & very little inclination to work - Have spent the greater part of the day in idleness  At night was alone in the office & wrote a long letter to _______________  Retire early after reading some in the Atlantic Mo'

Wednesday, October 10 1866
Beautiful day  Dull and not much doing  Played too much - Worked some - At night played cards - The office with Denny Rheinart & c

Thursday, October 11 1866
Pleasant today  Paid for a pair of boots $12  Recd of John M?i..id? his note $21.35 -  F?..rd? ?ing? Sultece? the death? of A? M? Fisher - Recd a letter from Millie & wrote her am by the morl? today

Friday, October 12 1866
Sherman went to Harrisburg & I was alone -  Answered? the claims against W E Washburn taking security on the house   Fine beautiful day but rather dull in the office

Saturday, October 13 1866
Weather fine   Been at home & in the office all day -  Settled with S H Jay? today & am pleased with the settlement - Jay sold all the old furniture & c & is about leaving for Vineland NJ - Called to see Mrs Hanlon just at night & spent an hour or more in her  society  Rec'd a letter from Millie & replied briefly

Sunday, October 14 1866
Went to Prs Church in the morning & ME Church at night  Read a little & slept a little & upon the whole spent the day unprofitably  Feel that my day has nearly ended

Monday, October 15 1866
Beautiful day  Looked around for rooms - Went with Dr Crabb? to look at my house - Went to Wilsons Hotel & then engaged a room finally - Left town at the usual hour for Muscatine - Holden is with me & Mrs Hanlon & all? found? Cadle? - Banks Hershe?  & c - Called with ?f.? Banks at his house -  Rec'd a letter today from Compton intimating that I had been made Maj in the Rg Army  unclear

Tuesday, October 16 1866
Left Muscatine early in the morning - At the junction met Mrs Hanlon on the train & [[occa..poned? her to Mellie?  Stopped at C??tl? at M..unclear & then got the License  & c -  Home? funy?  Was of ce..nplod? to get through & meet?

Wednesday, October 17 1866
Beautiful morning - Retired early & slept very well - Walked & visited in the morning. A Mrs Ritchman came & c  _______________  About 1 pm was - - - - - - - - - - - - how queer!
Everything passed? off very pleasantly. The friends are all very good & very pleasant people  The minister went through with the whole form. Some bridal presents were made with little speeches by each of the parties - children & all  Took the cars at 4PM & arrived in Davenport about 9 PM & soon retire

Thursday, October 18 1866
Spent the day in Davenport - Went with - - - - - -  & Mrs Harden shopping in the morning - My first experience in that line - Got bonnets & c  Wind blew & the unclear very de..ly? - Called on Atty Brown? & was by him introduced to Pa..t? of the firm Pa?ter? & Edwards  Recd a call from Mr Mrs Martin - from Mr & Mrs Nash & c -  R..t? cool but the mosquitoes & c are terrible

Friday, October 19 1866
Rose early - took breakfast & took the cars at 6? AM for Washington -  Fare $3.20 each - Fare from Laden cutoff Davenport was $4.35 - Had a pleasant ride & arrived safe in Wash - at the round house? & recd the congratulations of friends & at night Mr & Mrs Thompson called - Expect the Band to serenade us at about 9 PM

Saturday, October 20 1866
Today unclear to Mr Thompson  Several calls made during the day  Paid Mrs Allen three dollars for board & for room  Had a pleasant room at Mr Thompsons & board at Mr A Andersons?

Sunday, October 24 1866
A little stormy? today  Went to Pres' Church in the morning however - Spent the balance of the day in our room

Monday, October 22 1866
Pleasant day - Worked some in the office  Party at Mr Thompsons on our account - Large? company - Passed off very pleasantly

Tuesday, October 23 1866
Bought at ? furniture store our furniture for the room

Wednesday, October 24 1866
Pretty busy during the day in moving the furniture re our room & fitting the same up - Costs like the mischief Pay $77.00 for Bedstead  $16 00 - Mattress Spring $15 Husk? or Husle? $7  chairs _________  Bureau & glass $24, Wash Stand $10 .. with a discount of $5.00

Thursday, October 25 1866
Rained last night & rained some today - Foggy & unpleasant out - Worked in the office some - Paid the bills of yesterday & bought the things? of today  Write this while sitting in our room at Mr Thompson -  Millie mending my old clothes & I in my shirt sleeves

Friday, October 26 1866
Worked in the office all day  Nothing strange  Played Eucher a little at night - Cloudy & unpleasant - Left ____ at home to go up town a little while at night & upon my return Found some one underlined unhappy  Will did not come and we were all disappointed

Saturday, October 27 1866
Rainy cloudy & unpleasant - very muddy again - At home all day - Will did not come but Mrs Lewis got a letter in which he & his wife said they could come with our folks next week - Wrote a letter to Aunt Sally & one to Rev? or Ren? Densmore - Rhinart in town today & we laughed at him about the County safe which he had proposed buying for the county & which the board ordered the buying of deferred - Spent the evening at home

Sunday, October 28 1866
Clear but not very pleasant - cold & ?  Went to ME Church in the morning & heard Rev Miller preach  Did not go at night but staid at Ho? house? & had music in the ? in the parlor - Then read a little & went to bed

Monday, October 29 1866
Clear sunny & quite pleasant - Sherman went to Sigourney this morning & I was left alone in the office - Examined the R..nd? for Geo? Black & P?edy? R..? & was und..at..? t?oy?   Write this in our room at 7 PM - M is opposite & at work with her needle

Tuesday, October 30 1866
Moderately pleasant - In the office all day but there was not much doing  Sherman did not get back - Some body is sick! underlined  At night went to 1st UP Church to Lectur of J S G Abbot - Subject Louis Napoleon - A very good lecture

Wednesday, October 31 1866
Cool but clear & pleasant - Someone quite unwell underlined today - Busy in the office fixing up the old matters of Peters? & ? matters with G D & H  Sherman came back just at night - Went up town after supper but did not stay long - soon returned to the room & retired early

Thursday, November 1 1866
Pleasant day  Learned this morning that Welch yesterday did what very much resembled stealing & today saw information was filed  & he ? over for grand larceny & Prosecuted for the state -  Will came back today with his wife - Hanpest? called at Mrs Axtells with my frau? - Am sleepy & propose? retiring soon

Friday, November 2 1866
Pleasant day  Put up our curtains this morning & did not get to the office until 9 A-M- Bought notes of Wm? Good? against Rebecca Deneghy? for $640 - Share of $70 00

Saturday, November 3 1866
Pleasant day - Good many people in town - there must have been a good deal of business done - Jay? sales today - Sherman attended  & bought? & ? lands for ourselves & Br...t? Sully? -  Will & his wife were down to our room at night & made a visit

Sunday, November 4 1866
Windy & not very pleasant  Went with Millie to the Pres' Church in the morning & to the ME Church at night - Walked with Will in the afternoon - Read some in the Atlantic during the day -

Monday, November 5. 1866
Cool but pleasant  Busy in the office all day - Sent money to Rev Gailey?

Tuesday, November 6 1866
Nothing unusual today - Looked for our folks a little but they did not come

Wednesday, November 7 1866
Our folks came today & I called at ? to see them & at night went to Mellie with ? with ? at Mrs Axtells   Nothing unusual today - Rainy at night -  Brought a note against Mr? Wilson & Mr Johnson for $745 - Sharing ? 70 Dollars

Thursday, November 8 1866
Foggy - then rainy but later cleared up & was warm & delightful - Not so many in town today as usual - ?urred? rottn? dull -  Go to our room early & sit & read while Millie knits by my side

Friday, November 9 1866
Pleasant day  Sherman went to Brighton & I was very busy in the office almost the entire day - D ?athwitt? had his trouble with Rane?  Drew up the paper of Mr Anderson v? Mr? Bra..? -

Saturday, November 10 1866
Pleasant ? today  Have been busy today - Examining the ? for Shep-Farnsworth & working the office -  Father & the girls visited us at the room at night  Millie has a new dress & cloak got made today

Sunday, November 11 1866
Went to ME Church morning & at night - Cold but not unpleasant today  Afternoon lounged around some & _____________________  Read some in John Godfrey

Monday, November 12 1866
Pleasant day - Attended to the case of Anderson vs Brin? - Forcible Entry & Detainer  Rail Road ?uting? at night  Gn Kirkwood was here & spoke a little

Tuesday, November 13 1866
Nothing unusual today - At house & in the office busy writing letters & attending to business - Sherman has a sore eye & does but little  At night Mr Mrs Dr Chilcote called & found us at the room in desh?belle? - Had a pleasant visit

Wednesday, November 14 1866
Cold Cloudy & raw - Late about rising & going to unclear with? Mr Holman? who wanted me to go out to the Country to pe?  testify? for ? a R?p?len..? case -NEWT? & ? McGuigan -  ????? - got back a little after 5PM -  Judge Dillon ? at the Pres' Church at night - The awards? to apply toward the exti?push?nt? of the Church dept debt?

Thursday, November 15 1866
Shermans eye still troublesome & has? stuck closer to the office than usual  Party at Mr Joe Lewis tonight - Went & staid until pretty near midnight -  Raining some at night

Friday, November 16 1866
Busy in the office all day - Wrote to W Plitark? about the business of the old firm  At night played Eucher at Mr Thompsons with him - Rheinart & Da?- Richards  Pleasant day

Saturday, November 17 1866
Cloudy & cold - The woods? appear to be dry & pnelt? ? - There is a  good deal of wood & produce in town

Sunday, November 18 1866
Went to Pres Church in the morning & to ME Church at night - Took dinner at Mrs Axtells - Slept some after dinner - Looked some stormy after dinner & did rain just a little but cleared off at night

Monday, November 19 1866
Pretty busy in the office - Attended to the Griley? matter  Loaned Rudd $500 of fathers money  Father & Darius came down today & at night I went with Mellie to the house & spent the evening

Tuesday, November 20 1866
Nothing new today - Shermans eye is sore & he does but little in the office  Loaned A Young? $800 or $500? of fathers money  Earned the reward? for Chas? Chir?wich? & was ? or that all the forenoon.  I sold my land in Union County - taking notes ? to Washington Frihel? -  He is to pay no tax for this year   Darius went home today

Wednesday, November 21 1866
Dull in the office  Did very little business today - Cloudy/cold in the forenoon but cleared up after dinner & was pleasant  At night sat up until late reading John Godfrey? which we finished at 11 o clock at night - Wrote W P bleck? today about an old account

Thursday, November 22 1866
Very dull in the office literally nothing doing  Worked at night in the office looking up the tax matters for the evns? in Ne?p..? for Flournoy - When I  went home found   ben? & the folks at Thompson playing cards - Played with them until 12 at night when I retired

Friday, November 23 1866
In the office all day - Drew up the petition in ? of Flournoy case  Bought a note against Andrew? at East..? paying about 313 dollars  At night played cards ?ain? in the office & when I went home found __________________

Saturday, November 24 1866
Nothing of interest today  Dull evy? to Br..n? lecture at night & there was a big crowd in attendance - Very good lecture

Sunday, November 25 1866
Went to ME Church meng (i.e., morning) - At night did not attend church - Rather cold and unpleasant - Just before dark went down to Fathers &mena..?ed? until dark - Will & ?ode? were there too

Monday, November 26 1866
Loaned of Fathers money $900 to Vincent - Brought ? home a Rocking cher $4.50  Engaged ? to Esq Ste?es? tomorrow to attend a suit between Holcomb & McClellen - Gr? for pett?

Tuesday, November 27 1866
Sleeted this morning & Esq Hins? to peth?ey? without me? Holcomb & McClellan - Staid until 12 - at night & the pey? had not ?ned? - Got home after 2 in the morning -  c?ld? twice & disputed? - Holcomb is an old f_____

Wednesday, November 28 1866
Learned today that I won the case last night though not getting the whole amount claimed - Sherman went to Dayton this morning before I got to the office & I did not see him before starting on the cars with Mellie for her home - Reached Muscatine just at night & put up at the Ay?in? - Bought a cap for $2.00  Saw Capt Banks? N?sh?

Thursday, November 29 1866
Left this morning at 7-15  - Did not get any breakfast at the Hotel & only got in Breakfast at Wiltn? while waiting for the cars - Reached Ladora? in time for dinner which unclear from? Roast Turkey this being the Thanksgiving - Folks all well  Snowed some today & at night the ground is quite white & the air real cold

Friday, November 30 1866
Cold as ?anlend? this morning  Started about 9 AM for Belle Plain where we arrived after a ride over a very rough road some after one PM - Find the folks well & plan to see? us? - Had cold roast Turkey for dinner - Called at Mr Bronns? the merchants in the evening & spent a pleasant time?  Drank with them

Saturday, December 1 1866
Weighed today 131 Lbs  Mellie weighed 127   Remained at Belle Plain until about 3 PM & then started for Ladora when we arrived sometime after night - Cold & unpleasant ride  Learned today that another person (Ellce?) was expecting - Funny!  Belle Plain is quite a thriving little town of perhaps 400 inhabitants -

Sunday, December 2 1866
Clear & pleasant in the morning though it very soon after clouded up & rained - "Al" came about noon & remained all day & we had a pleasant visit - though I fear they regarded me as dull company - Have family prayers here morning & night & each member takes turns - Retire early & fasten the door   very fortunately too far an effort is soon made by ____ to come in &  ? us out

Monday, December 3 1866
Foggy in the morning but soon clears up & the sun shines - Al & his wife start for home  Almost 4 pm we start for the cars & arrive at Muscatine about 8pm - Saw Mr Ketchum at
Marrys? & anot?ey? at unclear as we suppo?ed? his new wife -

Leave Muscatine soon after 9 A M & arrive safely at home about 11 AM - Pleasant day - Glad to get back & no mistake - Folks all well  Work in the afternoon some & at night for again to the office with Mellie

Wednesday, December 5 1866
Foggy & rainy today - In the office all day - Not much doing he?en? - Dep $100 in bank to my accounts - Lib? was in a while in the afternoon -  At night go again to the office & this is written while sitting there with Mellie present & sitting opposite knitting - Sherman is fixing up the matters of Eddys claim against Deney -  Deny? is about fom? up -

Thursday, December 6 1866
Busy in the office all day posting books? - finished posting at dark  Sat in the office & read a little after supper - Went home & read the "Presidents Message"

Friday, December 7 1866
Wet foggy & muddy & in the afternoon & at night rained quite hard  In the office all day doing little or nothing - very dull - no ones in town hardly -  At night played sen..? up at Mr Thompsons a little - Read some in the Atlantic Monthly & went asleep about 11 PM

Saturday, December 8 1866
Snowed last night & this morning the ground is white - The sun shines clear & pleasant however

Sunday, December 9 1866
Did not to church in the morning - Went at night to M E - Cold & unpleasant - Took a fine bath in the morning - Read some in the Atlantic & c    - At night after service called at  Mrs Axtells & spent an hour pleasantly

Monday, December 10 1866
The C?..dsler? of R Deng came down today - Devusl? & Dellavoy? & Bro? - the first fim Checago & the ? frm Muscatine -  Garretson? unclear.... - We got Deny to confers? payment on an clo?is? & then farr??h?d? Garretson - Draper is he? for Doom? &  Dellavoy? himself

Tuesday, December 11 1866
Working at Denys mothers all day - Did not get through invoicing today

Wednesday, December 12 1866
Weighed 154 Lbs
Cold today but not so cold as for a day a ? past -  Worked today as before at Denys books? & c - Wrote a good many dunning letters   Learned today that we have been probably victimized in two notes we brought on J S Carris? - The notes are probably forged & we lose about $140?

Thursday, December 13 1866
Cold day   Shep Fournault? & Emma Crabb wan?ed? today a  ? & ?ight? - Everybody went? & we among the Rest?   ? a severe? cold at the party - The worried? before? the company came

Friday, December 14 1866
Sherman went to Mount Pleasant today with Burnet? N P? blat?te? in R R matter - Roads are very rough - Busy in the office all day & made some money f the C?ul?t? of Profit & Loss

1866.
Saturday, December 15. Snowed today & at night is still snowing  Busy in the office but did not accomplish much —charging up as fees only about $7-

1866.
Sunday, December 16. The snow is about 5 inches deep & it has drifted some. Stayed at home all day ? going to ?als?. Sun shone pleasantly  Sherman got back about 4 PM & I called in the evening at Mrs Axtells & staid a few minutes  Had a fine bath

1866.
Monday, December 17. Beautiful winter day. Good many people in town but our business rather dull. Got out a executive? agst Serrell Hiles? & c  Sherman left on the train going to Brewer to collect as I am unclear by Moser? in unclear? of a N T. Ferris.  He gets $50 a day & expenses. Tuesday, December 18 1866
Today collected the note against Canna? Casmn? $200. & t?h? & the note against Ogan? & c  Let Will have $100. & Ceemis? have $50 __ & bought a note of Butt?n? paying $70. fr $80  Called with Mellie at Fullirs & spent the evening

Wednesday, December 19 1866
Nothing new today  snow that fell last Saturday night is melting now  Pretty busy in the office and made some money  Bought Kerosene for the house & office Paid $35 if sold Burham? - 1/2 of this is fees  Played checkers & Cones? with Thompson & family

Thursday, December 20 1866
Cloudy & a little stery?  Been in the office all day but have not been very busy  Paid Mrs Axtell the balance due her on board -  Paid ?ente? $5.00 for helping with the safe

Friday, December 21 1866
? amt? less interest & part of princpal on that note? ganist? Hempbull?
Sherman is still gone & I am alone & kept busy in the office -unpleasantly so a part of the time

Saturday, December 22 1866
Not much doing today - Roads bad & not much hand?

Sunday, December 23 1866
Muddy & unpleasant being out & we did not go to church but staid at home all day  Mrs Lynch had her dr..? picked while she was at her supper of some $40-

Monday, December 24 1866
Busy in the office all alone. Sherman still gone  Collected the judgments against Ja?? R Mitchell & made some fees a the same  Went home pretty early & played 7 up a while before going to bed

Tuesday, December 25 1866
Rec'd of Sevill a payment $145 00 through Dep Sheriff in Executive   Dined at Mr Thompsons on Oysters - Fine dinner

Wednesday, December 26 1866
Today settled the case of Trin..? Broth? vs Wm French & c & made a good thing for the firm & for myself  Busy in the office all day

Thursday, December 27 1866
Very dull today & did not do much business  Had Tommy engaged to saw some wood for me

Friday, December 28 1866
Sherman came home today & was right glad to see him fr I have been? very much confined to the office  Tried before Esq Lvy? the case of the Plotrcyst? v W? Bro?m? - with Will - He was convicted & fined $10 00

Saturday, December 29 1866
This too is a cold day - Did a good deal of business and made as we think now? $400 00?  At night Mellie  Sherman & Mr Lewis Will & his wife went down to Fathers and  spent the evening  Good pleasant time

Sunday, December 30 1866
Cold day with some indication of a storm of snow  Went to Pres Church in the morning & heard Rev Shearer? - Slept some after dinner  at night went to ME Church & heard Rev Miller - Read some in "Dred" & go to sleep at 11 PM

Monday, December 31 1866
Cold  Snowed a little last night  Arose at the usual hour - Paid Mr Anderson for our board to Jan 1st $27 00  Gave Mellie $6 00 to buy present fr Mrs Thompson
